alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 10:39PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Somerset, southern Wicomico, Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1039 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Princess Anne to near Lawsonia to near Onancock. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ocean City, Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, Berlin, Snow Hill, Parksley, Westover, Marion Station, Newark, Lawsonia, Cape Isle Of Wight, West Pocomoke, Ocean Pines, Bloxom, Saxis, Hallwood, Whitehaven, Ocean City Municipality and Cokesbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico
